customer_reviews.title: Kind of Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing actually does work as advertised. OK, any 1500 watt heater is going to struggle to heat a room. There's an inherent limitation there, you can only push out so much electric heat without tripping a circuit breaker or starting a fire. But unlike a different small 1500 watt ceramic heater I bought recently (which I also like), this one actually heats the room pretty evenly. Almost subtly. The heat seems to be more evenly distributed than with your typical little ceramic heater.
customer_reviews.author: Disaster Sauce

customer_reviews.title: it is light not as sturdy as my old one but works fine in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a Vornado Vortex Heater for 15 years until it died on me a couple of months ago, it was well built & pricey but worked very well, I decided to purchase a lesser pricey product, it is light not as sturdy as my old one but works fine in a small room, I would not buy other brand because Vornado has a better quality, you got what you paid for, good investment
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Iskandar

customer_reviews.title: I judged this product too quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This little heater despite it's footprint does a great job in keeping the living area of an RV warm on cold to frigid nights. When Vornado states it's a whole room heater they weren't kidding. Temps have been dropping where I am at the moment into the low to mid 20's to mid 30's but this heater maintains a comfortable 65-70 degree.
customer_reviews.author: K-9 Sasha

customer_reviews.title: It does a poor job of circulating the air and spreading its heat ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried many different types of heaters to supplement a huge house with high ceilings, even the new mica flat panel, with no cigar. Finally, I decided to pay a bit more for a Mr. Heater. It was exactly what I've been looking for. Plus, energy-saving features that actually work and barely budge the electric bill running near constantly at 78 degrees! Every cold house needs a warm zone!
customer_reviews.author: Gary A Hurlbert

customer_reviews.title: Trouble keeping a set temperature
customer_reviews.text: I like this heater but I am continually trying to pick the right number on the dial to keep our babies room at 70. It doesn't seem to be based on the final temperature in the room. On nights when our furnace is on more her room is hotter for example. It is pretty cool to the touch for the kids. Also it easily shuts off when tipped. You do have to make sure you know if it has been tripped off sometimes because it still looks on.
customer_reviews.author: Highjumpfarm

customer_reviews.title: Im much warmer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this heater it keeps the room so warm even makes it hot and I am cold blooded so it is nice you can adjust it easily. I can wait to take this to our cabin in Colorado it will make it so much better. Also the airflow is so smooth and there is no smoking smell.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great heater, very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: It does a nice job of heating a medium size room, it is very quiet and can be used at night while sleeping. Nice design, can swich to lower watt usage to decrease chances of flipping a circuit breaker, has a tip off safety mechanism. Finally, it has an attractive design. it is the best 1500 watt heater of over a dozen that i have owned; pricier than others, but worth the extra cost for the nice performance.
customer_reviews.author: Secretam007

customer_reviews.title: This is a Wonderful, heater!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a heater for my upstairs, that has no main heater vent. After trying 3 different heaters, I picked this one. It warms the rooms immediately, and it has been 7 to 27 degrees here. you can hear it, but it's not disturbing. It circulates the heat so it warms but not all the heat in one direction. Unit or cord does not get hot enough to be harmful to touch. I would highly recommend this heater to anyone,
